content.p: meX-Search is a clustering search engine with a visually pleasing user interface (try version with the human agent!). meX-Search uses Carrot2's Lingo algorithm to cluster search results.
eTools.ch is a fast meta search engine developed in Switzerland that uses bits of infrastructure and the commercial version of the Lingo algorithm to group search results by topic.

SearchBlox is a high-performance Content Search Software designed for corporate intranets, websites, portals and custom-applications, which offers -powered clustered search results presentation as an option.
Grokker is enterprise search management software that uses some parts of Carrot2 infrastructure and the commercial version of the Lingo algorithm to cluster enterprise search results.
Focuseek used algorithms to add the dynamic clustering feature to their enterprise search software called Nautilus.
deepVertical runs over 40 vertical search engines and uses parts of Carrot2 infrastructure and the commercial version of the Lingo algorithm for search results clustering.
SideKiq can send queries to many different search engines and Carrot2 is one of SideKiq's search engines showing clustered results.
Greenona features a SearchBlox search engine with -powered search results clustering.
Nutch is open source web-search software that features a clustering plugin powered by Carrot2's Lingo algorithm.
Five Mushrooms is a Nutch-based culinary search engine that offers search results clustering powered by Carrot2's Lingo algorithm.

Iris is an Open Source semantic desktop application framework that enables users to create a personal map across their office-related information objects. It uses Carrot2's Lingo algorithm to cluster web search results.
